results.text: The target creature isn’t amused by your antics. They call over [[/r 1d4+1]] of their friends with the claim that you’re intending to start something.

You go a little overboard on your threatening display. Whatever item you are currently holding becomes broken. If you are not currently holding anything, the Narrator chooses either an item on your person or a nearby item that is broken instead.
The interrogation isn’t going according to plan and your tactics aren’t working. The target refuses to provide you with any further information.
Your threats are falling on deaf or disinterested ears. You have disadvantage on your next Intimidation check.
You botch your attempt at flourishing your weapon. You immediately drop your weapon, requiring an action to retrieve it.

Your attempt at intimidation is laughable at best. You suffer a –2 penalty to any Prestige checks made within 2 miles of the incident as the story of your humiliation spreads. This penalty lasts for 2 weeks, after which locals forget about it entirely.
